page.title: 11LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: {THE PARISH}-The{"douzaine"}of St. Sampson's parish consists of 12 men who are resposible for parish affairs such as rate payment, the issue of gun and dog licences, the arrangement of refuse collection, and the cutting of hedges, and clearing of streams. They also supply benefit for needy families. Each parish on the Island holds{elections every 3 yrs.}to vote in deputies to be the parish representatives on the{States of} {Guernsey}(the Island's Governing Body). The States are responsible for the policy making in the Island, and each Deputy sits on various committees within the States. St. Sampson's parish has{4 elected Deputies representing the parish on the States of Guernsey.
